pr_title: GH-2011 merge strategy and checklist added to PR template

timeline.message:
GH-2011 explain merge strategy in PR template

- added checklist to help authors
- added links to more detailed explanation of merge strategy on website
GH-2011 PR checklist and merge strategy added to template

timeline.bodyText: From having added a checklist like this in one of my previous projects I don't belive that it actually works as a checklist. We can always try, but I think it would work just as well as a regular list.

+PR Author Checklist:

+ - [ ] every commit has been [signed off](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/1962094/what-is-the-sign-off-feature-in-git-for)

replies.bodyText:
Yeah, agreed, I've used it before as well and it never really works as a proper list to check things off. My intent here is not so much to force people to actually tick the boxes, more as a list of reminders - using checkboxes to render to make it (hopefully) a little more obvious that these are actionable items.
Let's try like this. If people tick them, great. If not, no harm done either.
replies.author: jeenbroekstra

timeline.message:
GH-2011 PR description no longer auto-closes issue

This will not work with squash and merge strategy because PR description
does not end up in the commit message (which is what triggers
auto-close).

timeline.bodyText: I'm not 100% sure but I believe auto-closing the issue may no longer work when using squash and merge because the PR description won't end up in the commit message. This is how auto-closing of issues worked in the past. It might still work though based on whether the PR is actually linked to an issue (which is a feature Github introduced very recently). In any case, I'm taking it out for brevity - if it still works that's great, if not, we're not misleading people.
